item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: fahmiab
item.content:encoded: Welcome to Telkom University Student Blog. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

Ideally, you will want such words to not be a part of your article focus.";s:10:"status_msg";s:18:"Focus to the point";}s:14:"title_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:143:"You've got your focus keyword(s) in the SEO title meaning it has the best chance of matching what users are searching for first up - nice work.";s:9:"more_info";s:494:"It's considered good practice to try to include your focus keyword(s) in the SEO title of a page because this is what people looking for the article are likely searching for. The higher chance of a keyword match, the greater the chance that your article will be found higher up in search results. Best practice is between 50 and 65 characters, with 60 being the sweet spot.";s:9:"more_info";s:712:"Your SEO title is the most important element because it is what users will see in search engine results. You'll want to make sure that you have your focus keywords in there, that it's a nice length, and that people will want to click on it. Best practices suggest keeping your titles between 50 and 65 characters including spaces, though in some cases 60 is the sweetspot. The length is important both for SEO ranking but also how your title will show up in search engines - long titles will be cut off visually and look bad. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO titles, just remember to make your title great for SEO but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:27:"Your SEO title is too short";}s:17:"metadesc_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:159:"The focus keyword for this article appears in the SEO description which means it has a better chance of matching what your visitors will search for, brilliant!";s:9:"more_info";s:456:"It's considered good practice to try to include your focus keyword(s) in the SEO description of your pages, because this is what people looking for the article are likely searching for. The higher chance of a keyword match, the higher chance your article will be found higher up in search results. Remember this is your chance to give a potential visitor a quick peek into what's inside your article. If they like what they read they'll click on your link.";s:10:"status_msg";s:48:"The SEO description contains your focus keywords";}s:15:"metadesc_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:132:"Your SEO description (or excerpt) is currently too short which means it has less of a chance ranking for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:505:"We recommend keeping your meta descriptions between 135 and 300 characters (including spaces). Doing so achieves a nice balance between populating your description with keywords to rank highly in search engines, and also keeping it to a readable length that won't be cut off in search engine results. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO meta descriptions, just remember to make your description great for SEO, but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:49:"Your meta description is less than 135 characters";}s:13:"slug_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:181:"You've got your focus keywords in the page slug which can help your page rank as you have a higher chance of matching search terms, and Google does index your page URL, great stuff!";s:9:"more_info";s:403:"The page URL you use for this post will be visible in search engine results, so it's important to also include words that the searcher is looking for (your focus keywords). It's debatable whether keywords in the slug are of any real search engine ranking benefit. One could assume that because the slug does get indexed, the algorithm may favour slugs more closely aligned with the topic being searched.";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"You've used your focus keyword in the page URL";}s:13:"keywords_used";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:148:"Focus keywords are intended to be unique so you're less likely to write duplicate content. Consider changing the focus keywords to something unique.";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:42:"You haven't used this focus keyword before";}s:16:"imgalts_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:252:"Alternative attribute text for images help search engines correctly index images and aid visually impaired readers. The text is also used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:9:"more_info";s:244:"Image alternative text attributes help search engines correctly index images, aid visually impaired readers, and the text is used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:81:"A good balance of images contain the focus keyword(s) in their alt attribute text";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:138:"The best practice minimum content length for the web is 300 words so we recommend you aim for at least this amount - the more the merrier.";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 267 words which is less than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:196:"Currently you haven't used any keywords in your content. The recommended density is 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:33:"You haven't used any keywords yet";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:162:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 75 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:58:"You have 61 internal and 14 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:171:"You've included your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content, which will help search engines and visitors quickly scope the topic of your article. Well done!";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your reader’s attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Don’t forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:64:"The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:153:"You've used keywords in 10 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"Your focus keyword was found in 10 subheadings";}}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: fahmiab
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Bernyanyi Itu Mudah
item.dc:creator: fahmiab
item.content:encoded:
Bagi beberapa orang, bernyanyi sudah sebagian dari hidup. Dimanapun dan kapanpun pasti kita bernyanyi walaupun tidak jelas atau sekedar menghibur diri. Bernyanyi akan sangat bermanfaat karena benyanyi membuat pikiran kita tidak kosong dan dapat menghilangkan stress.

Untuk sebagian orang, ada yang bernyanyi hanya sekedar bernyanyi, tetapi ada juga orang yang bernyanyi sudah menjadi passion mereka. Pada kesempatan kali ini saya akan memberikan tips bernyanyi secara efisien untuk kalian yang fokus pada passion kalian yaitu bernyanyi.

Pertama: Pemanasan

Pemanasan saat akan bernyanyi adalah hal yang paling utama dan paling penting. Karena pemanasan akan mendorong perlahan sistem organ kita yang berhubungan dengan pernafasan, tekanan, dll. Gunakanlah pemanasan yang mudah dan simpel tidak membuat kita lelah sesaat kita akan bernyanyi seperti:

a. Bernafas dari hidung dan keluar lewat mulut secara perlahan, ulangi hingga 3x dan begitu sebaliknya dari mulut keluar ke hidung,

b. Regangkan tubuh dengan gerakan-gerakan simpel pemanasan dari kepala hingga kaki,

c. Bernafas dari hidung dan keluarkan lewat mulut secara mendesis,

d. Lakukanlah humming atau menggumam dengan nada do re mi fa so la si do dari nada rendah ke tinggi dan sebaliknya, di ulang hingga 3x.

Kedua: Atur Pernafasan Saat Bernyanyi dan Gunakan organ yang benar saat bernyanyi

Atur nafas kalian saat kalian bernyanyi dengan cara hindari bernyanyi dengan menggunakan tenggorokan. Gunakanlah pernafasan diafragma, karena dengan kita menggunakan pernafasan diafragma akan lebih banyak penyimpanan nafas kita. Cara mengeceknya yaitu dengan kita menarik nafas dan bahu kita tidak terangkat dan punggung menggembang serta dada dan perut mengembang. Jika kita sudah bisa dengan pernafasan diafragma, atur udara yang tersimpan dengan langit-langit mulut dan juga perut, jangan sampai terlalu banyak mengeluarkan udara. Cara mengeceknya yaitu dengan cara saat kita meniup, yang keluar adalah udara yang dingin bukan hangat atau panas.

Ketiga: Berlatihlah Sesering Mungkin

Dengan kita berlatih secara rutin dan dengan suasana hati yang senang serta tenang, tubuh dan organ kita akan terbiasa dengan hal yang sudah kita sering lakukan. Oleh karena itu, saat kita bernyanyi akan terasa ringan dan mudah.

Keempat: Jaga Pola Hidup

Gaya pola hidup kita akan sangat berpengaruh. Salah satunya yaitu jenis makanan yang kita makan menentukan kesehatan pita suara kita. Oleh karena itu, kurangi makanan yang berminyak, minuman dingin terlalu sering, dan makanan lain yang membuat tenggorokan kita kurang enak. Tidak hanya makanan saja tetapi kesehatan kita juga akan berpengaruh, oleh karena itu rutinkan berolahraga untuk menjaga stamina dan daya tahan tubuh kita.

Di atas adalah beberapa tips yang saya berikan untuk bernyanyi dengan efisien dan mudah. Semoga tips yang saya berikan dapat membantu kalian dan bisa membuat kalian bisa bernyanyi denga lebih baik. Jika ada kekurangan atau pertanyaan silakan tambahkan di kolom komentar Guysss ;D

In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your reader’s attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Don’t forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:64:"The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:153:"You've used keywords in 13 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"Your focus keyword was found in 13 subheadings";}}}

item.title: BEN ID
item.dc:creator: fahmiab
item.content:encoded:
Pengisian Bensin Online

Seperti yang kita tau, kendaraan di zaman sekarang sudah sangat banyak dan terus meningkat jumlahnya. Dari meningkatnya jumlah kendaraan yang ada, akan meningkat juga penggunaan bensin yang di butuhkan. Banyaknya orang-orang yang membutuhkan isi bensin yang akan mebuat pom bensin penuh dan antri panjang terutama saat-saat liburan atau hari raya.


Dari masalah tersebut, kami berencana membuat aplikasi berbasis android dan ios yang terhubung dengan nomor ktp atau atm bernama BEN ID. BEN ID adalah suatu aplikasi yang digunakan pengguna bertujuan memudahkan pengguna untuk melakukan pemesanan bensin online dengan mudah dan efisien. Jadi seperti layaknya kita ingin memesan tiket bioskop secara online dan menerapkan hal tersebut untuk pembelian bensin agar dapat mengurangi antrian Panjang saat mengisi bbm.

Caranya BEN ID akan dihubungkan dengan atm atau ktp kita sebagai alat pembayaran. Jadi, di dalam aplikasi tersebut kita mengintegrasikan saldo dalam aplikasi dan terhubung ke sistem pom bensin terdekat sesuai google maps yang ada. Aplikasi akan mengantar anda untuk membuka sistem maps dan mencari lokasi pom bensi terdekat, dengan itu setelah sistem mendapatkan lokasi pom bensin terdekat anda akan di arahkan untuk mengisi berapa nominal yang akan anda isi pada kendaraan Anda. Setelah konfirmasi, sistem akan memberi pemberitahuan lewat aplikasi tersebut jika berhasil dan langsung terintegrasi dengan ktp atau atm yang anda input. Saldo di dalam aplikasi akan otomatis berkurang sesuai jumlah yang anda masukan pada tahap pengisian.

Setelahnya Anda tiba ke pom bensin, disana akan disediakan alat untuk tap kartu atm atau ktp anda untuk mengkonfirmasi bensin yang akan diisi. Setelah itu petugas akan mengisikan bensin sesuai yang sudah diperintahkan oleh sistem. Setelah selesai mengisi, Anda akan mendapat pesan lewat aplikasi yang berisi struk atau bukti pembelian jika anda ingin di mencetak resinya silahkan klik download pada tombol download yang sudah tertera di aplikasi BEN ID tersebut.

Ya, seperti itulah cara kerja dari aplikasi bayar bensin online. Dengan itu banyak manfaat yang di dapat antara lain: mengurangi kemacetan yang di sebabkan antrian pom bensin yang panjang, mengurangi penipuan-penipuan yang biasa terjadi saat pengisian bbm, mengurangi antrian dan mengefisienkan waktu pengisian bbm.

You'll want to make sure that you have your focus keywords in there, that it's a nice length, and that people will want to click on it. Best practices suggest keeping your titles between 50 and 65 characters including spaces, though in some cases 60 is the sweetspot. The length is important both for SEO ranking but also how your title will show up in search engines - long titles will be cut off visually and look bad. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO titles, just remember to make your title great for SEO but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:27:"Your SEO title is too short";}s:17:"metadesc_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:159:"The focus keyword for this article appears in the SEO description which means it has a better chance of matching what your visitors will search for, brilliant!";s:9:"more_info";s:456:"It's considered good practice to try to include your focus keyword(s) in the SEO description of your pages, because this is what people looking for the article are likely searching for. It's debatable whether keywords in the slug are of any real search engine ranking benefit. One could assume that because the slug does get indexed, the algorithm may favour slugs more closely aligned with the topic being searched.";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"You've used your focus keyword in the page URL";}s:13:"keywords_used";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:148:"Focus keywords are intended to be unique so you're less likely to write duplicate content. Consider changing the focus keywords to something unique.";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:42:"You haven't used this focus keyword before";}s:16:"imgalts_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:252:"Alternative attribute text for images help search engines correctly index images and aid visually impaired readers. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:9:"more_info";s:244:"Image alternative text attributes help search engines correctly index images, aid visually impaired readers, and the text is used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:81:"A good balance of images contain the focus keyword(s) in their alt attribute text";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:74:"Your content is longer than the recommend minimum of 300 words, excellent!";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 561 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:196:"Currently you haven't used any keywords in your content. The recommended density is 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:33:"You haven't used any keywords yet";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:162:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 79 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Don’t forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"Your focus keyword was found in 10 subheadings";}}}

item.title: Autobiografi
item.dc:creator: fahmiab
item.content:encoded:
Fahmi Abdillah Al Amien

Nama saya Fahmi Abdillah Al Amien, biasa dipanggil Fahmi. Saya lahir di Yogyakarta, 29 Juni 2001 dan sekarang saya berdomisili di Kota Kebumen, Jawa Tengah. Saya adalah anak ke-3 dari 3 bersaudara dengan 2 kakak saya adalah laki-laki. Hobi saya adalah futsal dan memancing. Saya orang yang humoris, kurang suka sama yang serius-serius. Saya memiliki motto hidup yaitu

Bersama Kita Bisa, Sendiri Juga Harus Bisa

Latar belakang pendidikan saya dimulai pada tahun 2007 yaitu saya mulai memasuki jenjang Taman Kanak-Kanak Nurul Islam yang berada tidak jauh dari tempat tinggal saya. Saya menempuh TK hanya satu tahun dan setelah itu berlanjut memasuki jenjang Sekolah Dasar Negeri Kawedusan yang tidak jauh juga dari tempat saya tinggal. Selama 6 tahun saya menempuh Sekolah Dasar (SD) saya mendapatkan pengalaman seperti pernah menjadi Pembawa Naskah Pancasila, Pemimpin Upacara, Pembaca Teks UUD 1945, dan menjadi Pleton pada saat Upacara Bendera. Selain itu, ada pengalaman lain yang saya dapatkan yaitu menjadi juara harapan 1 pada ajang lomba Musik Rebana, mendapat juara 5 besar 3 tahun berturut-turut pada event Pramuka Pesta Siaga, pernah menjadi pasukan Drumband yang memegang Trio dan di akhir kelas 6 SD, saya dan teman-teman kelas saya berhasil membawa SD saya kedalam peringkat 3 besar dengan nilai rata-rata Ujian Nasional Tertinggi se-Kabupaten Kebumen. Setelah Lulus SD, tahun 2014 saya melanjutkan jenjang pendidikan Sekolah Menengah Pertama di salah satu SMP favorit di Kebumen yaitu SMP Negeri 3 Kebumen. Pengalaman yang saya dapatkan selama SMP yaitu menjadi salah satu pasukan dalam Upacara Bendera Sekolah, menjadi Vokalis grup band sekolah dan menjadi anggota Paduan Suara SMPN 3 Kebumen. Setelah Lulus dari SMP Negeri 3 Kebumen, tahun 2017 saya melajutkan Jenjang Pendidikan saya di salah satu Sekolah Menengah Atas (SMA) favorit di Kebumen yaitu SMA Negeri 2 Kebumen (SMANDA). Pengalaman selama 3 tahun saya di SMA yaitu menjadi Anggota Paduan Suara Inti SMANDA dan mendapatkan Juara 2 se-Kabupaten Kebumen dan melajutkan kejuaraan di Korem Yogyakarta, seringkali dimintai tampil di acara-acara kantor naungan pemerintah seperti di BPN yang mengundang Presiden Joko Widodo sebagai sambutan acara dan untuk peresmian event pembagian 1000 surat tanah ke masyarakat Kebumen. Selain itu, pengalaman lain saya selama di SMA yaitu menjadi Ketua Umum organisasi musik yang mencakup paduan suara dan musik itu sendiri selama 2 periode, dan pernah menjadi Ketua 1 pada event Pagelaran Pameran Festival Band dan Makanan se-Kedu Banyumas Yogyakarta.

Usai kelulusan saya pada tahun 2019 di SMANDA, saya mencoba mengikuti Tes SBMPTN dan Tes STAN tetapi mungkin memang bukan rezeki saya dan saya memutuskan untuk mendaftar di Universitas Telkom dengan masuk melewatu Jalur JPA 2 dan akhirnya saya diterima sehingga saya melanjutkan jenjang pendidikan Sarjana di Universitas Telkom dengan Jurusan S1 Rekayasa Perangkat Lunak hingga sekarang masuk semester 5 pada tahun 2021 akhir. Pengalaman yang saya dapatkan selama saya kuliah yaitu menjadi ketua tim pada event Telkom University Choir (TUC) dan berhasil membawa tim saya mendapat Juara Umum pada event tersebut, dan selama di TUC pengalaman lainnya yaitu membuat konser Paduan Suara Angkatan 19. Selain itu, saya mencari pengalaman lain selama kuliah yaitu masuk ke suatu organisasi Formatur HIMA RPL dan ikut di kepanitian Launching HIMA sebagai Wakil Ketua Pelaksana. Baru-baru saja saya dan teman saya satu tim, berhasil masuk ke dalam 10 besar Kompetisi UI/UX Tingkat Nasional yang di gelar oleh Universitas Ahmad Dahlan Yogyakarta.

Harapan saya saat ini yaitu, dengan pengalaman yang saya dapatkan semoga menjadi bahan saya untuk lebih mudah masuk ke dalam dunia kerja dan mendapatkan passion saya yang sesungguhnya.

Target saya yaitu dapat lulus dengan cumlaude di 3,5 tahun saya kuliah di Telkom University dan mendapatkan pekerjaan yang sesuai dengan passion saya. Sehingga saya dapat membuat orang tua saya bangga Amiinn...Amiinn

You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:81:"A good balance of images contain the focus keyword(s) in their alt attribute text";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:74:"Your content is longer than the recommend minimum of 300 words, excellent!";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 821 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:196:"Currently you haven't used any keywords in your content. The recommended density is 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:33:"You haven't used any keywords yet";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:162:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 75 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:58:"You have 64 internal and 11 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:171:"You've included your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content, which will help search engines and visitors quickly scope the topic of your article. Well done!";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your reader’s attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Don’t forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:64:"The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:153:"You've used keywords in 10 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"Your focus keyword was found in 10 subheadings";}}}
